activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Defendant Kenneth Ray Davis appeared by ZOOM.  Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by ZOOM for Kenneth Ray Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Miller Carroll heard on status - no offer made, request JT.
ADA reviews file - no offer made, recently sent discovery.
ADA heard on possible amendment.
Court schedules STC and holds off on scheduling anything further until all settlements have been made.
Atty Miller Carroll heard on ZOOM appearance for next hearing.
Court responds - if plea, in person is require otherwise ZOOM is approved if no plea.
3:08 pm
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Letter to Judge - Request Zoom - ZOOM request APPROVED by Judge 10-20-22

8:31 AM Defendant Kenneth Ray Davis appeared by ZOOM.  Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by ZOOM for Kenneth Ray Davis.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Carroll heard - has reviewed complaint with Deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives right to personal appearance.
Waives formal reading.
Court reviews PrelimQues/WOR.
Deft heard and waives prelim.
Court finds deft freely waives prelim and binds over for trial.
Arraignment 8:35.
ADA heard - information will be filed today and will track the complaint.
Atty Carroll - waives a formal reading and enters not guilty pleas.
Request status.
Court schedules with parties.
8:37 am
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter to Judge - Request Zoom - ZOOM appearance APPROVED by Judge 8-16-22

9:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth Ray Davis appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by Zoom video for Kenneth Ray Davis. 
Court calls case. 
Due to audio problems-court reschedules. 
Court schedules with parties. 
9:02 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to judge requesting Zoom appearance for Adjourned Initial Appearance

11:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth Ray Davis appeared by video, in custody. Atty Spansail in court by video for bond purposes only. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of complaint. 
Maximum penalties and charges. 
Atty spks- deft to hire private counsel. 
Deft agrees. 
ADA spks on bond recommendation. 
Atty spks on bond recommendation. 
Court imposes: $500.00 cash bond with conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid Rx and no contact with Co-Deft J.S. 
Court schedules with parties.
